p: We found that thresholding probabilities of occurrence into presence–absence can generate almost as much uncertainty as the climate hypothesis used. Serious concerns about the uncertainty stemming from choosing a thresholding procedure have been raised for predictions to current conditions (Freeman & Moisen, 2008; Jimenez‐Valverde & Lobo, 2007; Liu, Berry, Dawson, & Pearson, 2005), so it is not surprising that this contributes substantial uncertainty for future projections as Nenzen and Araujo ( 2011) also found.
